subject: RE: [junit] Multi windows

messageBody:
Dan,
Cactus may help you test this (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus) but I
think you should think about what you want to test here. Do you want to make
sure that the window comes up? That functionality belongs to the application
server and to the browser and probably doesn't need to be tested again. If
you want to test the javascript in the page then you'll want to use JsUnit
(http://www.edwardh.com/jsunit/) but this won't let you test functions that
open windows very easily. One approach, if you can do a little refactoring,
is to write a wrapper function around window.open(...). Something like
launchWindow(url). Then you can stub out that function in your unit tests so
that a window will not actually be opened. This will let you test the logic
in the calling function only and to verify that the correct url was passed
to the launchWindow function... If you want to test the javascript in
multiple pages then you can write a TestSuite for JsUnit.
I have yet to find an integrated system for testing javascript in
conjunction with serverside code -- I don't think one exists short of going
to a functional testing approach like WinRunner or the likes.

Chris

I have to test a Web application which, after a login and password window
continues on a new window (with window.open....)
How can I continue the test on this new window by taking the corresponding
request or something like that ?
